CFBundleDocumentTypesModel.markdownDescription: Describes a document type associated with the app.

LSItemContentTypes.description:
List of UTI strings defining a supported file type; e.g. for PNG files, use 'public.png'. See [UTI Reference]( https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Miscellaneous/Reference/UTIRef/Articles/System-DeclaredUniformTypeIdentifiers.html) for more info about the system-defined UTIs. Custom UTIs can be defined via 'UTExportedTypeDeclarations'. UTIs defined by other apps (not the system) need to be imported via 'UTImportedTypeDeclarations'.

See [Fun with UTIs](https://www.cocoanetics.com/2012/09/fun-with-uti/) for more info.
LSItemContentTypes.markdownDescription:
List of UTI strings defining a supported file type; e.g. for PNG files, use 'public.png'. See [UTI Reference]( https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Miscellaneous/Reference/UTIRef/Articles/System-DeclaredUniformTypeIdentifiers.html) for more info about the system-defined UTIs. Custom UTIs can be defined via 'UTExportedTypeDeclarations'. UTIs defined by other apps (not the system) need to be imported via 'UTImportedTypeDeclarations'.

See [Fun with UTIs](https://www.cocoanetics.com/2012/09/fun-with-uti/) for more info.
LSItemContentTypes.title: Lsitemcontenttypes

LSHandlerRank.description: Determines how Launch Services ranks this app among the apps that declare themselves editors or viewers of files of this type.
LSHandlerRank.markdownDescription: Determines how Launch Services ranks this app among the apps that declare themselves editors or viewers of files of this type.
LSHandlerRank.title: Lshandlerrank

name.description: The name of the menu item. Can be a dictionary if the name depends on installation parameters. See `MenuItemNameDict` for details.
name.markdownDescription: The name of the menu item. Can be a dictionary if the name depends on installation parameters. See `MenuItemNameDict` for details.
name.title: Name

description.description: A longer description of the menu item. Shown on popup messages.
description.markdownDescription: A longer description of the menu item. Shown on popup messages.

icon.description: Path to the file representing or containing the icon.
icon.markdownDescription: Path to the file representing or containing the icon.
icon.title: Icon

command.description: Command to run with the menu item, expressed as a list of strings where each string is an argument.
command.markdownDescription: Command to run with the menu item, expressed as a list of strings where each string is an argument.
command.title: Command

working_dir.description: Working directory for the running process. Defaults to user directory on each platform.
working_dir.markdownDescription: Working directory for the running process. Defaults to user directory on each platform.

precommand.description: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the command is run. Runs before the environment is activated, if that applies.
precommand.markdownDescription: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the command is run. Runs before the environment is activated, if that applies.
precommand.title: Precommand

precreate.description: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the shortcut is created.
precreate.markdownDescription: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the shortcut is created.

activate.description: Whether to activate the target environment before running `command`.
activate.markdownDescription: Whether to activate the target environment before running `command`.
activate.title: Activate

terminal.description: Whether run the program in a terminal/console or not. On Windows, it only has an effect if `activate` is true. On MacOS, the application will ignore command-line arguments.
terminal.markdownDescription: Whether run the program in a terminal/console or not. On Windows, it only has an effect if `activate` is true. On MacOS, the application will ignore command-line arguments.
terminal.title: Terminal

Categories.markdownDescription: Categories in which the entry should be shown in a menu. See 'Registered categories' in the [Menu Spec]( http://www.freedesktop.org/Standards/menu-spec).

DBusActivatable.description: A boolean value specifying if D-Bus activation is supported for this application.
DBusActivatable.markdownDescription: A boolean value specifying if D-Bus activation is supported for this application.
DBusActivatable.title: Dbusactivatable

GenericName.description: Generic name of the application; e.g. if the name is 'conda', this would be 'Package Manager'.
GenericName.markdownDescription: Generic name of the application; e.g. if the name is 'conda', this would be 'Package Manager'.
GenericName.title: Genericname

Hidden.description: Disable shortcut, signaling a missing resource.
Hidden.markdownDescription: Disable shortcut, signaling a missing resource.
Hidden.title: Hidden

Implements.description: List of supported interfaces. See 'Interfaces' in [Desktop Entry Spec]( https://specifications.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/latest/interfaces.html).
Implements.markdownDescription: List of supported interfaces. See 'Interfaces' in [Desktop Entry Spec]( https://specifications.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/latest/interfaces.html).

Keywords.description: Additional terms to describe this shortcut to aid in searching.
Keywords.markdownDescription: Additional terms to describe this shortcut to aid in searching.
Keywords.title: Keywords

MimeType.description: The MIME type(s) supported by this application. Note this includes file types and URL protocols. For URL protocols, use `x-scheme-handler/your-protocol-here`. For example, if you want to register `menuinst:`, you would include `x-scheme-handler/menuinst`.
MimeType.markdownDescription: The MIME type(s) supported by this application. Note this includes file types and URL protocols. For URL protocols, use `x-scheme-handler/your-protocol-here`. For example, if you want to register `menuinst:`, you would include `x-scheme-handler/menuinst`.
MimeType.title: Mimetype

NoDisplay.description: Do not show this item in the menu. Useful to associate MIME types and other registrations, without having an actual clickable item. Not to be confused with 'Hidden'.
NoDisplay.markdownDescription: Do not show this item in the menu. Useful to associate MIME types and other registrations, without having an actual clickable item. Not to be confused with 'Hidden'.
NoDisplay.title: Nodisplay

NotShowIn.description: Desktop environments that should NOT display this item. It'll check against `$XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP`.
NotShowIn.markdownDescription: Desktop environments that should NOT display this item. It'll check against `$XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP`.
NotShowIn.title: Notshowin

OnlyShowIn.description: Desktop environments that should display this item. It'll check against `$XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP`.
OnlyShowIn.markdownDescription: Desktop environments that should display this item. It'll check against `$XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP`.
OnlyShowIn.title: Onlyshowin

PrefersNonDefaultGPU.description: Hint that the app prefers to be run on a more powerful discrete GPU if available.
PrefersNonDefaultGPU.markdownDescription: Hint that the app prefers to be run on a more powerful discrete GPU if available.
PrefersNonDefaultGPU.title: Prefersnondefaultgpu

SingleMainWindow.description: Do not show the 'New Window' option in the app's context menu.
SingleMainWindow.markdownDescription: Do not show the 'New Window' option in the app's context menu.
SingleMainWindow.title: Singlemainwindow

TryExec.description: Filename or absolute path to an executable file on disk used to determine if the program is actually installed and can be run. If the test fails, the shortcut might be ignored / hidden.
TryExec.markdownDescription: Filename or absolute path to an executable file on disk used to determine if the program is actually installed and can be run. If the test fails, the shortcut might be ignored / hidden.
TryExec.title: Tryexec

glob_patterns.description: Map of custom MIME types to their corresponding glob patterns (e.g. `*.txt`). Only needed if you define custom MIME types in `MimeType`.
glob_patterns.markdownDescription: Map of custom MIME types to their corresponding glob patterns (e.g. `*.txt`). Only needed if you define custom MIME types in `MimeType`.
glob_patterns.title: Glob Patterns

CFBundleDisplayName.markdownDescription: Display name of the bundle, visible to users and used by Siri. If not provided, 'menuinst' will use the 'name' field.

CFBundleIdentifier.description: Unique identifier for the shortcut. Typically uses a reverse-DNS format. If not provided, 'menuinst' will generate one from the 'name' field.
CFBundleIdentifier.markdownDescription: Unique identifier for the shortcut. Typically uses a reverse-DNS format. If not provided, 'menuinst' will generate one from the 'name' field.

CFBundleName.description: Short name of the bundle. May be used if `CFBundleDisplayName` is absent. If not provided, 'menuinst' will generate one from the 'name' field.
CFBundleName.markdownDescription: Short name of the bundle. May be used if `CFBundleDisplayName` is absent. If not provided, 'menuinst' will generate one from the 'name' field.

CFBundleSpokenName.markdownDescription: Suitable replacement for text-to-speech operations on the app. For example, 'my app one two three' instead of 'MyApp123'.

app_user_model_id.description:
Identifier used in Windows 7 and above to associate processes, files and windows with a particular application. If your shortcut produces duplicated icons, you need to define this field. If not set, it will default to `Menuinst.<name>`.

See [AppUserModelID docs]( https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/shell/appids#how-to-form-an-application-defined-appusermodelid) for more information on the required string format.
app_user_model_id.markdownDescription:
Identifier used in Windows 7 and above to associate processes, files and windows with a particular application. If your shortcut produces duplicated icons, you need to define this field. If not set, it will default to `Menuinst.<name>`.

See [AppUserModelID docs]( https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/shell/appids#how-to-form-an-application-defined-appusermodelid) for more information on the required string format.
app_user_model_id.title: App User Model Id
